{"step_by_step_thinking": "The Liley curve is used to assess the severity of Rh incompatibility in a fetus. The curve is divided into three zones: Zone 1 (low risk), Zone 2 (moderate risk), and Zone 3 (high risk). A value in the top of the third zone indicates severe Rh incompatibility, which can lead to severe anemia and hydrops fetalis, a serious fetal condition. Immediate delivery at 28 weeks could lead to significant neonatal morbidity and mortality due to prematurity. Plasmapheresis is not typically used in the management of Rh incompatibility. Repeating the amniocentesis after 1 week would not address the immediate risk to the fetus.
